definition: to rob the rich to help the poor
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
rich/abundant/wealthy
surname Fu
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
poor/inadequate/deficient/garrulous

sentences.english: Redistributing wealth from the rich to the poor only reduces the wealth of both groups, but particularly of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 而劫富濟貧會使雙方的財富都減少，特別是窮人。

sentences.english: In their minds, is the Robin Hood-like bandit hero.
sentences.chinese: 在他們的頭腦裏，強盜就是劫富濟貧的英雄好漢。

sentences.english: In their eyes, the robber is maxi-cans good example.
sentences.chinese: 在他們眼裏，強盜就是劫富濟貧的好榜樣。

sentences.english: And why would Robin Hood want to rob them to help the poor?
sentences.chinese: 又是爲什麼羅賓漢要劫富濟貧呢？

sentences.english: Robin hood and his men robbed the rich to help the poor.
sentences.chinese: 羅賓漢和他的夥伴們劫富濟貧。

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
overbearing/arrogant bully
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to walk right into the trap
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
trivial matter/a piece of cake
willingly and gladly (idiom)
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
